Douglas Davies - A Brief History of Death
Blackwell Publishers | 2005 | ISBN: 1405101822 | Pages: 184 | PDF

Death is a subject of enduring interest in every culture in the world. The act of death itself and the rituals surrounding it vary enormously and shed a fascinating light on the cultures of which they are a part.

Douglas J. Davies, internationally acknowledged as one of the leading experts in this field, tackles some of the most significant aspects of death ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ the act of dying, grieving, burial, artistic interpretations of death, places of memory, the fear of death, and disasters/tragedies ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ and weaves them into a compelling story about our changing attitudes to dying.
